crops.name: Strawberries (summer & perpetual)
crops.depth: Set crown at soil level (do not bury)
crops.protection: Netting vs birds; straw/liners to keep fruit clean; slug barriers
crops.tips: Remove runners unless propagating; replace plants every 3–4 years
crops.notes: Perpetual (everbearers) crop smaller but longer; summer types heavier, shorter season

crops.name: Raspberries (summer & autumn)
crops.depth: Plant canes to nursery soil mark
crops.where: Direct soil, raised beds, large containers with supports
crops.protection: Netting vs birds; mulch to conserve moisture
crops.tips: Tie to wires; prune per type (summer: remove fruited canes; autumn: cut all to ground in winter)
crops.notes: Autumn types are simplest for beginners and pots

crops.name: Blackberries (incl. thornless)
crops.where: Direct soil with trellis/fence; extra‑large planters
crops.tips: Train on wires; remove fruited canes after harvest; tie in new growth
crops.notes: Thornless modern cultivars are compact and easier to manage

crops.name: Blueberries
crops.depth: Plant at same depth as pot; do not bury stem base
crops.protection: Netting vs birds; fleece in late frosts at blossom
crops.tips: Use rainwater; grow at least two cultivars for better pollination
crops.notes: Mulch with pine needles/bark to maintain acidity

crops.name: Currants (black, red, white)
crops.depth: Plant 5cm deeper than nursery mark (encourages new shoots)
crops.protection: Netting vs birds; winter wash if scale/aphids noted
crops.tips: Prune to open goblet shape; remove old wood to encourage new growth
crops.notes: Blackcurrants fruit on young wood; red/white on older spurs—prune accordingly

crops.name: Gooseberries
crops.protection: Net vs birds; watch for gooseberry sawfly
crops.tips: Summer prune sideshoots; maintain open centre to reduce mildew
crops.notes: Pick early firm fruits for cooking; fully ripe for dessert

crops.name: Hybrid berries (Tayberry, Loganberry, Boysenberry)
crops.where: Direct soil with trellis; very large planters with supports
crops.tips: Train long canes on wires; prune like blackberries (remove fruited canes, tie in new)
crops.notes: Large aromatic berries with long harvest window
